text: BIODIVERSITY AND OPEN SPACE Tower Hamlets Local Plan 327 BIODIVERSITY AND OPEN SPACE Supporting text 18.68 While Tower Hamlets is a densely built-up urban area, it nevertheless is home to a diverse range of flora, fauna, and different habitats of biodiversity value, including areas of open space, waterways and formally designated Sites of Importance for Nature Conservation (SINCs). There are two Local Nature Reserves in the borough at Mudchute and Tower Hamlets Cemetery Park. 18.69 Living building elements can enhance biodiversity, both directly through planting and indirectly through providing habitats. They also have flood reduction, climatic and air quality benefits, helping to remove carbon dioxide from the air and reduce temperatures.
